front.title: Deterministic Hashed Data Elision: Problem Statement and Areas of Work

abstract.t: This document discusses the privacy and human rights benefits of data minimization via the methodology of hashed data elision and how it can help protocols to fulfill the guidelines of RFC 6973: Privacy Considerations for Internet Protocols and RFC 8280: Research into Human Rights Protocol Considerations. Additional details discuss how the extant Gordian Envelope draft can provide further benefits in these categories.
